name: reference-conflicts-analyzer
description: Analyze reference conflicts and dependency graph of .NET applications.
author: Dealogic

inputs.name: pathOfFileToAnalyze
inputs.label: path of file to analyze
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the .NET application entry point.

inputs.name: pathOfConfigFile
inputs.label: path of config file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the .NET application configuration file.

inputs.name: ignoreSystemAssemblies
inputs.label: ignore system assemblies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Exclude from the analysis assemblies with names starting with 'System'. Default value is true.

inputs.name: diagramAttachmentEnabled
inputs.label: attach diagram to build summary
inputs.helpMarkDown: The dependency graph as a diagram will be shown on the build summary page. WARNING! OAuth token must be provided for this to the build step.

inputs.name: diagramZoomLevel
inputs.label: diagram zoom level
inputs.helpMarkDown: The zoom level of the attached diagram. By default it's 1. It has to be a floating number.

inputs.name: treatResolvedVersionConflictsAs
inputs.label: treat resolved version conflicts as
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to treat version conflicts are resolved by configuration file.

inputs.name: treatOtherConflictsAs
inputs.label: treat other reference conflicts as
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to treat other reference conflicts.

inputs.name: treatUnusedAssembliesAs
inputs.label: treat unused assemblies as
inputs.helpMarkDown: How the unused assemblies are reported. By default reported as warnings.

inputs.name: treatMissedAssembliesAs
inputs.label: treat missed assemblies as
inputs.helpMarkDown: How the assembly is missed are reported. By default reported as warnings.

inputs.name: workingFolder
inputs.label: working folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working folder where the reference conflicts analysis will run. If you leave it blank it is the root of the repository.

inputs.name: referenceConflictsAnalyzerCliDownloadUrl
inputs.label: url of Reference Conflicts Analyzer
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL of the Reference Conflicts Analyzer command line tool.
